sense.name: place under contract via a signature
sense.examples: He won't sign the purchase agreement without reviewing it with his lawyer. The soprano signed to sing the new opera. They signed two new pitchers for the next season.

sense.name: communicate through gestural conventions
sense.examples: He tried to sign to me that he'd spotted a seahorse during the dive, but I didn't understand. During his speech they had someone signing so that the deaf could follow along.

sense.name: write one's signature
sense.examples: She always signs her name in black ink. The actor signed hundreds of autographs that evening.

sense.name: physically place signposts.
sense.examples: They need to sign this intersection better!

sense.name: religious gesture
sense.examples: The woman signed herself before entering the small chapel.

sense.name: SKIP using X for all VERB PARTICLE CONSTRUCTIONS
sense.commentary: includes VPC: SIGN AWAY, SIGN OFF, SIGN ON, SIGN OVER, SIGN UP
